item.title: Lally’s Rensselaer Finance Club Opens Applications for Positions in Student-Managed Investment Fund
item.description: Date: Tuesday, December 3, 2024 12:00 AM - Wed , December 11, 2024 12:00 AM - The Rensselaer Finance Club will be initiating a student-managed Investment Fund at the start of the Spring 2025 semester; students who are interested in managing real money and learning more about investment management should apply by December 11! Students from all degrees and disciplines are eligible for positions in the Fund.

item.title: Book Your COMM+D Appointment Online!
item.description: Are you working on a writing assignment, oral presentation, or visual design project? Whether you’re at the beginning brainstorming stages or finishing up your final revisions, the Center for Global Communication+Design (Comm+D) can help! Just schedule an appointment with a member of our trained staff, then stop by the Comm+D offices on the lower level of Folsom Library.

item.title: Charles Curtis to Play Within | Without Limit: Music for Cello
item.description: Date: Saturday, December 14, 2024 2:00 PM - Internationally acclaimed Charles Curtis performs a Saturday matinee solo program that takes full advantage of the generous acoustic properties of the EMPAC Concert Hall! The program includes works by Carolyn Chen, Éliane Radigue, Guillaume de Machaut (14th c.), and Curtis’s own “Unfinished Song” (1998).

item.title: Volunteers Needed for Annual Late-Night Student Breakfast
item.description: Auxiliary Services and Rensselaer Dining are looking for volunteers to help serve a late-night breakfast to students on Thursday, December 12 from 8:30PM to 10:30PM. This is a perfect time to engage with students in a fun environment! Anyone interested in participating can contact Betsy Preston or James Simmons to sign up.

item.title: New Breakthrough Sheds Light on the Evolution and Adaptability of Photosynthetic Organisms
item.description: A team of researchers at Rensselaer, Pennsylvania State University, Yale University, and Louisiana State University has revealed the structure of a modified and evolved version of Photosystem I (PS I), a key protein complex used by plants and cyanobacteria to convert sunlight into chemical energy. This discovery sheds light on the evolution and adaptation of photosynthetic organisms and could potentially lead to new, highly efficient systems for producing renewable solar fuels.

item.description: A list for faculty interested in instructional technologies, pedagogy, and innovative tools for classroom engagement, the Teaching and Learning e-Newsflash has been created to support faculty who wish to try new technologies and strategies for learning.
